fields.description:
Within companies it's necessary to have usernames and passwords that may be used to access a shared resource.  Other times, the default passwords are needed for the initial login as an administrator on machines.  It's helpful to be able to document these passwords in Jira or a wiki, but they shouldn't be displayed in plain text or index.  Without this documentation, these passwords are kept as tribal knowledge and/or shared via email/chat.

It would be nice to be able to put the complete password into documentation that would be accessible by authenticated users, but obscured to non-authenticated users and obscured until the user specifically clicks to see the password.  (A similar scheme is used with phone numbers on Craigslist)
fields.summary: Support Passwords in Markdown syntax

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Activity stream gadget "Streams available" gone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a dashboard;
# Add the *Activity stream* gadget;
# On the settings the *Available streams* has gone.
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-07 at 10.34.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* In the [Atlassian documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/activity-stream-gadget-724765460.html] it says it should appear.

h3.Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget "Available streams" and Ability to apply filter based on project have been removed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement
Tracking or undoing deleted issues are impossible as it is not stored or tracked in the applications. After issue(s) are deleted, there are no way to track them besides having support to check on the logs. However, logs are only stored for a week and there is not much information that can help audit or restore the issue.

h3. Suggestion
Allow tracking of issue deleted, moved and undo function and visible in the audit logs
fields.summary: Allow tracking of issue deleted, moved and undo function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When REST PUT  is made to change the request type of an issue that has a completely different workflow is made, the result is a success. This shouldn't be the case as a change like this invalidates the workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two workflows with different status
 # Associate issue type separately to the two workflows created above
 # Create two Jira issue and set each request type to the workflows created earlier
 # If you attempt to change the issue type from the UI, it won't be possible.  
 # If you attempt to change the issue type via REST api, the issue type is changed. This shouldn't be possible.

For Example:
PUT [https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/SDD-17\\|https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/SDD-17/] 
{
"fields": \{"issuetype":{"id":10002}}
}

h3. Expected Results

An error should be returned that this is not possible.
h3. Actual Results

A successful execution is returned.
h3. Workaround

Currently none.
fields.summary: Using REST API the issue type can be change when workflows are completely different

fields.description:
h1. Summary

If assignee, reporter or a user or group custom fields are treated inconsistently by search and view issue when affected by field visibility/configuration.
h1. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a permission scheme where browse projects is assigned to the assignee field. Associate this scheme with a project FOO with a single issue FOO-1.
 # Assign issue FOO-1 to user X. User X can now browse to FOO-1 and it turns up in search results.
 # Hide the assignee field in the field configuration associated with FOO. Reindex when prompted.
 # User X can still browse to FOO-1, however it no longer turns up in search results.

h1. Expected results

Either:
 * After hiding and reindexing the issue still shows up in search results and can still be browsed to, or;
 * After hiding and reindexing the issue neither shows up in search results nor can be browsed to.

The same affect is observed for reporter, user and group custom field permission grant types. Similarly removing the custom field configuration for a project has the same effect.
fields.summary: Assignee, reporter, user custom field and group custom field permission types are treated inconsistently between search and view issue

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour
In the documentation related to the notification scheme: 
[Adding, editing, and deleting notification schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/adding-editing-and-deleting-notification-schemes-868982885.html]
The title *How to add project notifications* does not provide any information about editing a project's notification scheme as it is expected, the link mentioned in the paragraph forwards to the same page.
h3. Expected behaviour: 
The document is supposed to explain: 
* how to access the notification scheme through *Issues* or through *project settings* 
* then how to edit the values of *event* and *recipients* entry. 
* Note: These informations can be partially found through this link: [Creating a notification scheme|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/creating-a-notification-scheme-776636401.html#Creatinganotificationscheme-assigning_scheme_to_project]
fields.summary: Update KB on how to edit notification scheme for cloud environment.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In some cases, it would be useful to hide an add-on section from the issue view.


h3. Suggested Solution

Implement an option to hide add-ons'section from the issue view.
fields.summary: Allow users to hide add-ons' sections from the issue view

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
External users under Software Application do not receive notification when creating Issues through e-mail.

*Suggested Solution:*
Configure JIRA Software to send notifications when users under Software Application open Issues through e-mail.

*Why is this important:*
Nowadays the users are not informed about the Issues updates.

*Workaround:*
Users need to contact someone that has access to the project/issue to know about the status/updates of this.
fields.summary: Notification For External Users Under Software Application

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The context for custom fields can be deleted without confirmation.

h3. Suggested Solution
In the delete button highlighted in the image below, add a confirmation that the existing data of the context will be deleted.
!configure-custom-field.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
This is a serious concern on the reliability as it's possible to delete something without confirmation. There is a chance to click in the cog icon to edit the context and click on the bin and delete it accidentally.
If you have for example a custom field with multiple preset values, if the context is deleted, you must recreate the context and edit all issues accordingly.
!custom-field-no-context.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Add a confirm dialog when deleting context of custom fields

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
The set of values of the Custom Field type *Select List (single choice)* is not editable under the transition screen.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow the set of values of the Custom Field type *Select List (single choice)* to be editable under the transition screen.

*Why is this important:*
When it’s necessary to add/remove values in the set of values it takes a long time when doing it to a lot of Issues through the Custom Field Configuration.

*Workaround:*
We go through the Custom Field Configuration to add/remove values in the set of values.
fields.summary: Custom Field Editable Under Transition Screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As documented in [Sharing a filter|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/saving-your-search-as-a-filter-765593721.html#Savingyoursearchasafilter-sharing_filtersSharingafilter] there should be a possibility to share the filter using:
{quote}
Tip: You can also share your filter by running it, then clicking *Details* > *Edit Permissions*.
{quote}

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Issue Navigator* > Use *Save as* to save your search results as a filter

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to share the filter immediately (clicking *Details* > *Edit Permissions*)

h3. Actual Results
There is no possibility to share the filter at this point


h3.Workaround
Go to *Search* > *View all filters* > *Manage Filters* > Find the filter > Click  *(...)* > *Edit Filter Details*.
* !edit filter details.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: There is no possibility to share the filter from "Details"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, CSV Import only allows Subtasks creation along with its Parent issue when associating the parent-subtask links.

h3. Suggested Solution
To allow the association parent-subtask linking via CSV import by specifying the Issue Key of the Parent issue in CSV file.

h3. Why this is important
An existing parent issue can be used.
fields.summary: Allow CSV Import Create Subtask of an Existing Parent Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As of now, there are only 2 JQL to find the linked issues (parentEpic and Linkedissue). However, these 2 JQL can't find any issues that are linked using _Issue Link_.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Add JQL to find linked issues
fields.summary: Add JQL to find linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

At the moment, there isn't any REST API endpoints to generate an xml backup or restore a backup.
h3. Suggestion

Create such endpoint
fields.summary: REST API endpoint for backup and restore

fields.description:
When I open any project in JIRA the default is Basic search. I need to click Advanced every time. I'd like some way to choose to make Advanced my default search for all projects.

I raised this o the Community and Branden McElveen couldn't find options and suggested that a customisation was needed.
fields.summary: Advanced Search as Default

fields.description:
I have more than 1 account @ Atlassian. All accounts have the same name "Ralph Bergmann".

 

When I click on my profile picture and open my Profile I can't the the email address. So it is hard to the with which account I'm logged in.

 

At the end: Please show the email address at the profile summary page
fields.summary: show email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Associating an Issue Type Scheme to a project causes the instance to OOME.

h3. How to Replicate
# A Jira project will need to have a large number of issues, (at least 1000).
# Attempt to associate the project with another Issue Type Scheme.

h3. Expected Result
* Association is successful.

h3. Actual Result
* Association is unsuccessful; the Jira instance OOMEs and restarts.

h3. Investigation Done
If you manually run a bulk move (e.g. from the result of JQL), the number of issues you can move in one operation is limited to 999 because of this memory limitation. If you do something that indirectly triggers a bulk migration (like changing the issue type scheme), this 999 limit is not checked (because you cannot partially migrate to a new issue type scheme) and so the migration may fail.

h3. Workaround
* Backup your Jira data and save it in a safe place.
* Create a new project with a similar configuration to the current one, but already having the required issue type scheme.
* Move issues from the old project to the new one in batches of 999.

If it is OK to have all the issues in the new project, then you are done. If the project must be kept the same, then:
* Change the old project issue type scheme as required. This should succeed, because now the project is empty.
* Move issues from the new project back to the old one in batches of 999.
fields.summary: Associating an Issue Type Scheme to a project causes the instance to OOME

fields.description: Quite often, we have zip files that contains a bunch of PNGs that would work better if they were lose files in the story attachments.
fields.summary: Offer the option to unzip a zip file when it is attached to a story

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issue detail view sidebar doesn't load on backlog

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud
* Affected instances don't have the new Jira experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the backlog of a board (scrum or kanban)
# Click on a issue

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar renders the issue details.

h3. Actual Results
The sidebar is blank
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
Open the issue directly:
- https://<your instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue key>
fields.summary: Issue detail view sidebar doesn't load on board's backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
There is no possibility to see the list on my *Favourite filters* using the new Jira Expirience

h3. Environment
Atlassian Cloud - new Jira Expirience ADG3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Search* > *View all filters*
# Check for Favourite filters 

h3. Expected Results
List of Favourite filters is available as in ADG2
*  !Favorite.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Favourite filters is not available, even if accessing the direct link as https://instancename.atlassian.net/secure/ManageFilters.jspa?page=1&filterView=favourites
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: No possibility to access Favourite Filters in the new Jira Expirience ADG3

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Currently, *Worklog Changed* event in webhook not working anymore. There is no way to trigger this event to send a webhook out.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Setup a webhook to send events based on *Worklog Changed*
# Create a worklog in an issue, then edit the worklog.

h2. Expected Result
It should trigger the webhook.

h2. Current Result
It doesn't trigger the webhook.

h2. Workaround
Used *Worklog Updated* event instead of *worklog changed*. 

h2. Additional Notes
Tried using REST API to update the worklog, still doesn't trigger *worklog changed* event.
fields.summary: Worklog Changed event in Webhook no longer working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to paste the attachment from clipboard on *Edit Comment* screen, the attachment is uploaded but the thumbnail is not added automatically.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Comment on an issue
# Edit the comment
# Attempt to add an image Copy an image from local machine
# Ctrl + V to paste image on comment

h3. Expected Results
The image is uploaded and the wiki markup of the attachments is automatically added to the comment.

h3. Actual Results
* The image is uploaded 
* The wiki markup of the attachments is not added to the comment.
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Happens on 'Drag-and-drop' functionality too.
* The thumbnail is actually added but is not showing on *Edit Comment* screen: Save the comment, the thumbnail is showing as expected.
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround. Save the comment, the thumbnail is showing as expected.
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Thumbnail Not Showing on Edit Comment Screen After Attachments Uploaded

fields.description: After utilizing the "Login as user" feature, there should be an option to "switch back" to your actual user under the dropdowns available. Perhaps under the User block or Gear icon.
fields.summary: "Log in as user" functionality should be easier to log out from
Field values missing in JIRA Api Logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a workload pie chart is added to a dashboard and the project/filter doesn't have issues with a current estimate it will render a 500 internal error, instead of showing a more friendly error message

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Dashboard
# Add the workload pie chart
# Chose to filter a project without any current estimation


h3. Expected Results

A message telling the user that those issues/project lack a current estimation in it.

h3. Actual Results

A 500 error is logged in the web console in the browser.

!Screen Shot 2017-12-04 at 4.30.18 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Workload Pie chart returns a 500 when current estimate is empty

fields.description:
The problem is that if someone enables the self-sign up to the instance, there is no log to verify who did it.
We need to investigate who made has enabled. There is no audit log to this part of the administration. 

We would like to be able to see who made this change or an audit log to control this information.
fields.summary: Need to Know Who Enabled Self-Sign Up

fields.description:
This feature request is based upon the cascading field.

To be specific we can only set the whole field as mandatory, but if we were to make an item from the parent list or the second list as mandatory, there is no such feature.

A better representation of how it would look like is if there are many different items in the parent list such as "Food, Type of color, and Size", it would be more flexible if the user had the option to make which particular item in the list must be chosen by the user.
fields.summary: Cascading Field - Making the item in Parent list or Child list mandatory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Canceling the attachment upload before completion causes the issue creation to be stuck

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue.
# Upload an attachment and cancel it before the completion

h3. Expected Results
As the upload was canceled, the issue is created without problems.

h3. Actual Results
The issue cannot be created, as you get the error: *Upload in progress, please wait.*
!upload-in-progress.png|thumbnail! 
As this status won't go away, it's necessary to cancel the issue creation and start over.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Canceling the attachment upload before completion causes the issue creation to be stuck

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
 The Share Issue button is only shown on the View Issue Screen.

*Suggested Solution:*
 Allow the Share Issue button available in the *Creating Issue Screen*.

*Why is this important:*
 When it’s necessary to share a lot of issues the actual procedure takes a long time because first is necessary to create the Issue and after do edit it to share with someone.

*Workaround:*
 We first create issues then after we share it.
fields.summary: Share button available on Creating Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, an internal comment will be treated as '[CHART] Date of First Response' value.

h3. Suggested Solution
Don't treat internal comment as '[CHART] Date of First Response' value. It should only take for first public comment.

h3. Why this is important
To make sure admin can be tracked correct data when agent first response to customer.
fields.summary: Time to first response chart will not treat Internal comment as first response

fields.description:
Summary

Some instances are experiencing performance issues and our internal team are actively working on it. We will keep you posted with further updates.
fields.summary: Some instances are having performance issues in Cloud

fields.description:
I need to be able to fill out “must” fields, but right now I can’t. I’ll get an error message by Jira, that Need to fill it out. 

 

Possible solutions:

 

- sub task appear in the same way then normal tasks (which is good). So I HAVE to fill out my project “standard “ fields for each sub task again. It would be great if all fields of a main task who appear in an sub task mask, are pre filled by the value/content of the main task. This would be great for the desktop version and it would resolve my issue with the app. Also it would ease the process of sub tasks. 

 

- be able during configuration of a field to decide if it’s a must have field for all kind of tasks or maybe not for sub tasks. 

 

Please let me know.
fields.summary: Creating Sub tasks on mobile phone:

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While the Description field is removed from Create Issue screen, when try to create linked issue by choosing "Create linked issue" from any issue, a modal (Create linked issue) will popup where the Description field is still available. However, there is no options (toolbar) at the top of Description field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From project settings, choose *Screens*
# Choose a screen for *Create issue* operation, for any issue type
# Remove the *Description* field (if is added)
# From any project/issue, click on more ( ... icon) and choose *Create linked issue*
# In the modal for create linked issue, choose the project and issue type for which the Description field is removed from create issue screen (step 1)

h3. Expected Results
* The Description field shouldn't be visible, as it's not added to the create issue screen

h3. Actual Results
* The Description field is available in the create linked issue screen
* The toolbar (options) is not visible at the top of description field
fields.summary: If the Description field is removed from Create Issue screen, when create linked issue (using "Create Linked Issue"), the Description field will still be available in create issue screen.

fields.description:
Right now you can enter both in your account details:

 
 * Full Name
 * User Name

 

No clue what is intend of user name if its not possible to swap between those to for the whole site.

I´d like to change into username system wide, but I can't.
fields.summary: user name instead of full name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new Jira layout, the asterisk mark for required field is overlapping with the field name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Opt-in for the new Jira experience.
# Have a required field with more than one line set as required.

h3. Expected Results
The asterisk mark appears on the side of the text, like in the old layout:
!old-layout.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The mark is overlapping with the text:
!field-required-broken.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
As previously mentioned, the problem is not occurring on the old layout.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: In the new Jira layout, the asterisk mark for required field is overlapping with the field name

fields.description: The ability to see metrics such as the monthly overall availability on status page. So we can see actual service availability over a period of time - say monthly. Gets reset each month. That would be nice and transparent. This would show how reliable Atlassian's services are.
fields.summary: Ability to see metrics published on Atlassian's Status Page
JIRA REST API Notify endpoint returns error 500 when using email address instead of user name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 

 In the Filters list, Inactive users (owners of the filter) will not have the label "(Inactive)" next to their name. Only when you delete the user (filter owner) from the system, the label "[X]" will appear next to the filter owner's name.
h3. Environment (Optional - If Applicable)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Settings -> System -> Shared filters, Or Issues > Manage filters
 # Find a filter owned by an inactive user

h1.  
h3. Expected Results

User's name should have the "(inactive)" label
h3. Actual Results

The inactive user's name does not have the "(inactive)" label
h3. Notes (Optional - If Necessary)

-
h3. Workaround 

-
fields.summary: Inactive users will not have the label "(Inactive)" on the Filters list in the column "Owner"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While sending an invitation to a new user on Jira and "Send invitation mail is unchecked", the user statistics show the message "Invitation sent few minutes ago". Although the mail is never sent
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to user management
 # invite a new user
 # Uncheck "Send invitation mail" 
 # Click invite users
 # From user select newly created user
 # Statistics show invitation sent a few seconds ago

h3. Expected Results

The statistics should show invitation not sent
h3. Actual Results

The statistic shows invitation sent.
h3. Workaround

Currently none.
fields.summary: When invite user unchecked message returns "Invitation Sent"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira import is failing with errors similar with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67172 (which has been closed as resolved). However, there are slight difference in the log, which indicates that they're of different variance.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform import from Cloud to Cloud 

h3. Expected Results
Import went successfully

h3. Actual Results

Sample Warn Message:
{code}
removeUser(*****) failed
{code}

Sample Stack Trace:
{code}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: removeUser(*****) failed
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.removeUser(CrowdServiceImpl.java:486)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.removeUser(DelegatingCrowdService.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.removeUser(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.removeUser(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.purgeUsers(UsersAndGroupsImportHelper.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:276)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$2(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:97)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:60)
	at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:59)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1590)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.AuthorizationException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"403","detail":"You do not have permission to make this request.","errorType":"InsufficientPermissions","message":"You do not have permission to make this request."}
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeException(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:568)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeExceptionIgnoringResult(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:530)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.makeRequestWithoutEntityBodyAndNoExpectedResponse(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:487)
	at com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.deleteUser(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:405)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory.lambda$removeUser$1(IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory.java:329)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory.withRetry(IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory.java:769)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory.removeUser(IdentityPlatformRemoteDirectory.java:328)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.removeRemoteUser(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1106)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.removeUser(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:1100)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.removeUser(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:437)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.application.ApplicationServiceGeneric.removeUser(ApplicationServiceGeneric.java:813)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.removeUser(CrowdServiceImpl.java:478)
	... 16 more
{code}

I think the main difference here and JRACLOUD-67172 is that there is *no ERROR-level entry* in the log at all. Even the import came out as "failed" without an ERROR stack trace. There are some DEBUG and WARN level entries that I could find though:
{code}
Activity jira-import failed with details: Provider jira-import reported a failure (success!=true) - {"success":false,"error":"Non recoverable error during cloudImport: Import task failed: [Error occurred while running the task. Please contact support.]","output":{}}
{code}

{code}
About to report to SWF failed completion of [jira-import, {"success":false,"error":"Non recoverable error during cloudImport: Import task failed: [Error occurred while running the task. Please contact support.]","output":{}}] with details=
{code}

{code}
Provisioner import flow completed. Success: 'false', import task id: '10001', message: 'Optional[[jira-import failed: Provider jira-import reported a failure (success!=true) - {"success":false,"error":"Non recoverable error during cloudImport: Import task failed: [Error occurred while running the task. Please contact support.]","output":{}}]]'
{code}

h3.Workaround
Same with JRACLOUD-67172
fields.summary: Non recoverable error during cloudImport: Import task failed: [Error occurred while running the task. Please contact support.]
JQL operators "AND NOT" doesn't work when using "comment"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using Jira Mobile in iOS in the URL fields, the links aren't clickable

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a URL link custom field
# Add the field to the View Issue Screen in a project
# Add a value to that field
# Open the issue in Jira Mobile using iOS
# Try to open the link in the field

h3. Expected Results
The value within the field should be a clickable hyperlink

h3. Actual Results
The value shows as a text and isn't clickable

h3. Workaround
Copy the value from the field and paste in Mobile's browser.
fields.summary: URL Link custom fields aren't clickable in Jira Mobile using iOS

fields.description:
The logo images in JIRA, when viewed on an Apple Retina display, appear pixilated and fuzzy.

Steps to Reproduce
Click in Look and feel > update logo
Even using the recommendation "We suggest a logo size of 368px width by 64px height."
the logo appears fuzzy

Workaround:
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Logo images for retina-display keeps in poor quality

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user cannot paste text into popup issue view text fields using MS Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Using MS Edge (Microsoft Edge 38.14393.1066.0) and n
# Go to Jira Software Board view
# Click on one issue card
# See issue popup above (new Jira layout)
# try to paste text in description and comment fields


h3. Expected Results

Text is pasted without problems

h3. Actual Results

Pasting fails for description and comment fields, ctrl+V and right click do not work
 
h3. Notes

It happens only using MS Edge and new issue detail view (popup)

h3.Workaround

* Use a different browser
* Disabling the Lab features on user profile:
# Click on your avatar, at the top-right of the screen then click *Profile*
# Under *Labs*, disable *Issue detail view*
fields.summary: Using MS Edge, the users cannot paste into popup issue view

fields.description:
*Customers Ask:*


Hi,\\ \\ I often use Jira advanced search to find issues, some of which were created quite some time ago, so I don't fully remember their summary. I only remember some words that might occur in any text fields, in summary or in description. And today I realized that Jira has a defect in text search, which makes it significantly harder to find an old issue. \(I've set impact to Level 3 because this is a use case which I do really often, and sometimes I have to spend more time searching for issues than I would expect to spend using a good search engine\). Below is a description of a defect:\\ \\ Imagine there is an issue with the word "A" in summary and word "B" in description \(word "A" doesn't occur in description and word "B" doesn't occur in summary\). But the following advanced search query doesn't return me anything:\\ \\ text \~ "A B"\\ \\ however the documentation says that "text" field is a "master-field" that allows you to search all text fields including summary and description. I find this behaviour to be poor because I really expect "text" field to search across all text fields.\\ \\ After some investigations and experiments I came to conclusion that Jira probably find only those tickets where both words "A" and "B" occur in the same text field, so it will find only tickets where both "A" anb "B" occur in summary or in description. Then I tried to find a workaround for this behaviour: I tried another advanced search query:\\ \\ text \~ "A" and text \~ "B"\\ \\ but this query gave me nothing again. And this looks really like a bug, because when I issue any of these subqueries separately Jira gives me my ticket as a result. I mean, query \{\{\{{text \~ "A"}}}} shows me my ticket in search results, and query \{\{\{{text \~ "B"}}}} shows me my ticket in results. So if my ticket satisfies both \{\{\{{text \~ "A"}}}} and \{\{\{{text \~ "B"}}}}, then I don't understand why it doesn't satisfy \{\{\{{text \~ "A" and text \~ "B"}}}}\?\\ \\ It looks like the only way to find my ticket by two words is to manually enumerate all possible combinations of text fields issuing multiple queries like:\\ \\ summary \~ "A" and description \~ "B"\\ \\ I hope you will be able to fix these problem, so that:\\ \- "text" master field will actually use \*all\* text fields for searching,\\ \- and that if issue satisfies both \{\{\{{text \~ "A"}}}} and \{\{\{{text \~ "B"}}}} then it will be found by \{\{\{{text \~ "A" and text \~ "B"}}}} \(and by \{\{\{{text \~ "A B"}}}}\) too.
fields.summary: Text Search Doesn't Work while Searching for Summary and Description

fields.description:
Is it possible to get a precise date and hour on the activity journal and user journal ?

Currently, when the event is just few days ago, the date appears as "3 days ago". Is it possible to have something like "26/nov/2017", as the older events ?
fields.summary: Get a precise datetime for all journal events

fields.description: Currently, REST API can be accessed by basic authentication and REST API can provide most of the information in Jira. This undermines the multi-factors authentication in UI.
fields.summary: Introduce a more secure authentication for REST API

fields.description: Issue updated timestamp should be updated on issue property modification like it updates on custom field modifications.
fields.summary: Issue updated timestamp should be updated once issue property (entity property) modified

fields.description:
*Summary*
 The user expects to see two arrows (back and forward) when looks for shared filters, but it shows one properly and the other with missing parts.
  
 *Environment*
  
 *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Settings
 # System
 # Shared Items > Search Shared Filters

 

*Expected Results*

A list of filters with two arrows for back and forward on the list.  

 

*Actual Results*

The button works, but the back arrow doesn't show properly (missing parts) and looks like a coma.  This only happens in new Jira interface.

 

*Workaround*

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Search Shared Filters - Back arrow not displaying properly in new JIRA interface

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira UI, there is no direct option to manage dashboards if you don't have a previously shared or favorited dashboard.
The highlighted arrow in the UI only appears if you have more than one dashboard on your list.
!menu-dashboards.png|thumbnail! 
!manage-dashboards.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to see this section for users who have de system dashboard only. Currently, if you don't have any dashboard, you need to access the System Dashboard, click on *...* menu > *Find dashboard*
!find-dashboards.png|thumbnail!

h3. Why this is important
It seems to be counter-intuitive to reach the options of the System Dashboard to find other dashboards.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Provide a more direct option to manage/find dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in *Shared Filters* (Setting > System > Shared Filters) page, it is not possible to review the filter. The (...) button on the right only has *Change Owner* and *Delete Filter* options. If an individual were to perform some deletion of filters, they are not able to review it before deleting.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an additional option when clicking on the (...) button to review the filters.

h3. Workaround
Navigate to *Manage Filter* (Issues > Manage Filter), and access the filter from here to review it before deleting/change owner. URL:
* https://instance_name.atlassian.net/secure/ManageFilters.jspa?filterView=search
fields.summary: Have the ability to review the filter in Shared Filters page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Time tracking field in JIRA accepts decimal values. This causes issues after repeated entry as the date logic eventually ends up with an estimate that is not valid.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue
 # Log work with a time such as 1h 11.33
 # Repeat until you get a value such as 3h 56.15m
 # Try to edit an issue an error will appear "You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away without first saving the data, the changes will be lost"

h3. Expected Results

Decimal values should not be able to be entered other than .5 as.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
cause = java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error occurred while converting time estimates:Durations must be in whole minutes,
{noformat}
 

Workaround

Only use multiples of .5 for time logging.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Field Accepts Decimal Value

fields.description:
Customer wants the issue to have his color changed after time passed and the status of the issue doesn't change.

She wants the issue to colour all the ticket.
fields.summary: Be able to turn an old pending issue in other color in order to alert the team

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently customers cannot change the color of app icons on the sidebar, they're white by default.

 !side bar original.png|thumbnail! !side bar_pointing the icon.png|thumbnail! !side bar white.png|thumbnail!

This makes so app icons are hard to see if there is not enough contrast with the sidebar color.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow customers to customize the color of app icons on the Jira [Look and feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-the-look-and-feel-of-your-jira-applications-780861527.html] settings just as they can select sidebar, text and default icon's colors.
h3. Why this is important

Further customization options for customers, better UI experience
h3. Workaround

(Optional)
fields.summary: Change the color of add-ons Icons

fields.description: Customer would like to export this project permissions in a CSV or Excel file.
fields.summary: Need to export all the project permissions assigned to users to Excel or CSV file

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The resizing of the 'Note' textbox in the 'Share this issue' is broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any issue and click on *Share this issue* button:
!share-button.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to resize the Note text box;
!normal-screen.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The text box is resized within the window boundaries.

h3. Actual Results
It's possible to resize the textbox outside the window boundaries and therefore you cannot resize back.
The *Share* and *Cancel* buttons go with the text box, and depending on how large is the resize it's not possible to see the buttons:
!broken-resize.png|thumbnail! 
!broken-resize-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The issue happens in both old and new Jira layout.

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: The resizing of the 'Note' textbox in the 'Share this issue' is broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary
We can't add attachment using "Take New Photo" in the Jira iOS mobile app

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
1. iOs Version 11.1.2
2. JIRA Cloud App version v43.0.0.189

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue
# Click "add attachment"
# Choose "Take New Photo"
# Photo will be loaded
# Click on "Create issue"
# The following error will be thrown:
#* {quote}Got error while saving attachment Photo 2017-11-29 11:56:08.jpg: Photo 2017-11-29 11:56:08.jpg contains the invalid character ':'. Please rename the file and try again.{quote}
fields.summary: Error when adding attachment using "Take New Photo" using Jira iOS Mobile App
Support other event types for JQL query in Webhook

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

The left side hamburger menu is loading two different tooltips with different translations in Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to your Jira instance through Firefox.
# Shrink the left-handed menu
# Hover the mouse over the hamburger menu
# Two different tooltips will load.

!Screen Shot 2017-11-29 at 12.27.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 


This doesn't occur in Chrome.

h3. Expected Results

Load only one tooltip and standardize the translation as in other languages it occurs.

h3. Actual Results

When hovering the mouse two tooltips for the hamburger menu are loaded, with different translations.

h3. Notes

This is reproducible in other languages too.
fields.summary: Jira ADG3 is loading two different tooltips in the hamburger menu in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
By default, once you create a filter, the filter is automatically set to private. It would be better if the filter is automatically set to 'Any logged-in users'.

h3. Suggested Solution
Setting default filter permission to 'Any logged-in users' upon filter's creation.

h3. Why this is important
This helps once you need to create dashboards quickly and having to edit the filters permissions is more time-consuming. 

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Default filter permission upon creation to 'Any logged-in users' instead of private
Include additional issue attributes in comment_* webhooks

fields.description: Customer needs the exact time for the Created, Updated and Resolved fields of the issue, in the List View.
fields.summary: Enable Exact Time for Created/Updated/Resolved Field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * There is no way to configure an "I' button (information button) that the user can click to get information about a particular field on the screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Creating Help for a Custom Field (Info Icon positioned in front of the field)

h3. Why this is important
 * This will describe further the custom field and ensure filling the field more efficiently.

h3. Workaround
 * For now, the only way is through the description of the custom field.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin I want to provide through a help icon further details about the created custom field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the View Issue screen, a multi-line custom field with a lot of text will not be utilizing the space available. Instead, it gets cut off and the space is left unused.
 !New-Jira-Experience.png|thumbnail! 

As can be seen from the screenshot, the space to the right of the field is unused.

h3. Suggested Solution
Extend the width that is available for the field. Currently, it is set to have a max-width of 400px.
This was not the case with the old Jira UI, where it was using all the space that is available.
 !Old-UI.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
Having a lot of text in a multi-line custom field would become very hard to read.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Custom Field in the New Jira Experience is not utilizing the space available
Cannot use JQL In Escalation Service because of failed: Add JQL LIMIT support

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to import only attachments to JIRA. It is not working when using a large data.zip file.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* File size: 3.7GB

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *JIRA > Restore System*
# Choose *Import attachments*
# Import a file > 3GB

h3. Expected Results
A message is prompted to inform whether the import is failed/success. Eg:
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
After the file uploaded, nothing happens. (It didn't carry the next step nor show any message)

h3.Workaround
# Extract the zipped file
# Split the attachments by projects with < 1GB each (before compressed). Eg:
{noformat}
attachments-1.zip
└─── data
      ├── attachments
      │         ├── ProjectKey1
      │         │         └── 10000
      │         │		├── IssueKey-1
      │         │		├── IssueKey-2
      │         │       	└── IssueKey-3
      │         ├── ProjectKey2
      │         └── ProjectKey3
      └── avatars
attachments-2.zip
└─── data
      └── attachments
                ├── ProjectKey4
                ├── ProjectKey5
                └── ProjectKey6
attachments-3.zip
└─── data
      └── attachments
                └── ProjectKey7
{noformat}
# Zip the files separately
# Import the files batch by batch
fields.summary: 'Import Attachments' Not Working When Using a Large Attachment Zipped File

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues are being loaded multiple times and this causes apps (add-ons) in the issue screen to be called multiple times as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to 'All issues' (Nav bar->issues->all issues)
# Click on an issue
# Issue seems to be loaded multiple times, causing the add-ons to be loaded multiple times for that issue.

h3. Expected Results
Issues should be loaded once

h3. Actual Results
Issues are loaded multiple times
 !Network.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes 
Upon further checking, the team suspects the Hipchat integration could be causing the multiple calls. Have yet to verify.

This will also affect other apps that are invoked every time an issue is loaded.
fields.summary: Addons are called multiple times in issue panel

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
 The tab names under the board of a project are not available to be renamed.

Example:  !Screen Shot 2017-11-28 at 5.43.23 PM.png!

*Suggested Solution:*
 Allow the tab names available to be editable.

*Why is this important:*
 This is a standard name. When editing it could have a name related to the project.

*Workaround:*
 The standard tab name is used.
fields.summary: Board - Tab Names Editable

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
The field Parent Link is not available when exporting issues. The available field is Parent ID, but it shows only the ID and not the issue key.

*Suggested Solution:*
Allow the Parent Link (the key) available when exporting issues.

*Why is this important:*
It’s necessary to make relationships with Sub-tasks and its parent tasks.

*Workaround:*
We are searching by JQL (one by one) to find the issue key.
fields.summary: Parent Link unavailable when exporting issues

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
There is no way to see the Autocomplete options just typing any part of a label name.

*Suggested Solution:*
A functionality witch the Autocomplete function shows the existing label name when typing just any part of its name.
{quote}For example: 
 Issue_01 - label = TEST01
 Issue_02 - label = TEST02

If typing “EST” the system should show both labels above to be choosen.
{quote}
*Why is this important:*
Sometimes the label is not known and only the full name of the label is not useful.

*Workaround:*
We are searching for the full label name.
fields.summary: Labels - Search for any part of label name

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 25/1/2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#91f17e|bgColor=#d4f7cd}
The recent roll-out of the [Removal of Comments from issue WebHooks|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/change-notice-removal-of-comments-from-issue-webhooks/] may have caused this issue to be back.

According to [SLAC-354|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/SLAC-354], the slack integration is supposed to be ready to switch to the new WebHooks but we are receiving reports from the customers stating otherwise.

We are currently investigating this issue and, in the meanwhile we have reverted this change.

Please open a case with support by logging a request in [https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] if you are still affected by this bug.
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update 23/02/2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|titleBGColor=#91f17e|bgColor=#d4f7cd}
The initial case was an issue with system addons update task at some Jira instances. Addon itself working stable and handling hooks properly, but since it was not updated at some instances such instances was not able to send new comment_created\comment_updated webhooks. This issue was resolved for most of the customers by restoring addon update tasks. We still have a few special cases that we will fix manually. 
{panel}
h3. Summary

Jira is not triggering notifications from comments on Slack.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Slack integration with Jira configured to send messages when someone leaves a comment:
 !slack-settings.png|thumbnail!
 # Comment on one issue

h3. Expected Results

The Slack room receives the notification from issue commented.
h3. Actual Results

No notification is sent to the room.
h3. Notes

The other events like *Issue created* or *Issue transitioned* are triggering notifications as expected.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Jira notifications from comments are not showing on Slack

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some cases, the default Issue Type Scheme does not have all the issues types present in the instance and, when changing the Issue Type Scheme of a project to the Default Issue Type Scheme, the change occurs but the user is not prompted about the issue type migration of existing issues that have issue types that are no longer applicable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a dummy project.
# Create a test issue choosing an issue type that is not present in the Default Issue Type Scheme.
# Go to the *project settings> Issue types* and change the issue type scheme to the Default Issue Type Scheme.

h3. Expected Results

* The user should be prompted to migrate the issue type of the existing issue to an issue type available in the Default Issue Type Scheme OR the Default Issue Type Scheme should have all the issue types available by default.

h3. Actual Results

* The issue type scheme is changed to Default Issue Type Scheme and the issue keeps with the issue type that is not present in the Default Issue Type Scheme.
 
h3. Notes

* This can cause issues to search for these issues, for instance, using a query like:

{code}assignee is empty{code}

h3.Workaround

* Create a copy of the Default Issue Type Scheme, add the missing issue types in the copy and associate the scheme with your project/s.
fields.summary: Default Issue Type Scheme does not have all issue types and issues are not migrated to an existing issue type

fields.description:
h3. h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field.
 # Add custom field to a screen with WIki markup and styled text.
 # Load the issue, width of custom field is correct and then changes to a smaller size: [https://screencast.com/t/jbpYP4zuBtu|https://screencast.com/t/iUW00zaFz]

Workaround: None at this time.
fields.summary: Custom field width changes with wiki styling in new JIRA experience.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some cases when attempting to download the backup of huge instances, the download dies before completion.

h3. Customer Impact

h3. Environment
* We've reproduced this issue with backups of 6GB, 20GB

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup of a huge instance
# Try to download it

h3. Expected Results
The download will finish successfully
h3. Actual Results

The download dies before completing. Sometimes it looks like it finished successfully as it doesn't through an error in the browser while downloading but the download file isn't complete.

*Application logs:*
{code}
 msg: java.io.IOException: Broken pipe 
 stack: org.apache.catalina.connector.ClientAbortException: java.io.IOException: Broken pipe at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.realWriteBytes(OutputBuffer.java:396) at org.apache.tomcat.util.buf.ByteChunk.flushBuffer(ByteChunk.java:426) at org.apache.tomcat.util.buf.ByteChunk.append(ByteChunk.java:339) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.writeBytes(OutputBuffer.java:421) at org.apache.catalina.connector.OutputBuffer.write(OutputBuffer.java:409) at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteOutputStream.write(CoyoteOutputStream.java:97) at com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.RoutableServletOutputStream.write(RoutableServ
{code}
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Workaround
Use the Google Chrome browser to perform the download (instead of Internet Explorer or FireFox or whatever else you're using)

Please let us know if the workaround does not work.
fields.summary: Backup download fails when the backup file is big

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The semicolon is not stripped out from a list of email addresses on the user invite

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to User Management, and click on *Invite user*
# Paste a list of email addresses separated by a semicolon, for example:
{code}1@example.com; 2@example.com; 3@example.com; 4@example.com;{code}

h3. Expected Results
The list of emails is processed correctly:
!invite-ok.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The semicolon will be included in every email address besides the last one:
!invite-wrong.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
If you type the email address manually and then insert the semicolon, the punctuation is ignored.
Additionally, the problem is not reproducible if the list has space or colon to separate the email addresses.

h3.Workaround
Replace the semicolon with a comma in the list of addresses you want to invite.
fields.summary: The semicolon is included in a list of email addresses in the user creation

fields.description:
*Problem definition:*
There is no way to configure the range of the days inside the startOfWeek() / endOfWeek() JQL functions.

*Suggested Solution:*
A functionality that allows us to define what should be the weekdays.

{quote}
- Examples:
A week must be from Monday to Friday;
A week must be from Monday to Saturday;
And so on
{quote}

*Why is this important:*
The process to define that range would allow saving a filter that always shows the same week, without change any parameters in the function.

*Workaround:*
We are using both functions changing its parameters every day to take the needed week.
fields.summary: Edit days of the week - startOfWeek()

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The hint of the *submit* button on the *create issue* screen is incorrect. It it showing:

_Press *undefined*+ s to submit this form_

h3. Suggested Solution

The phrase should match the *Modifier key* of the browser:
_Press *Ctrl*+ s to submit this form_
Or, at least, be generic:
_Press *Modifier Key*+ s to submit this form_

But it is not undefined...

h3. Why this is important
 
Mostly to leave things tidy, enhancing the user experience.

h3. Workaround 

There is none
fields.summary: Incorrect hint for submit button on create issue form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian Update, May 9th, 2019:*

Hello everyone,

This suggestion is implemented in Jira cloud. Now, a Create Version button will be permanently visible on top of the version list. You can add a new version without waiting for all versions to load on the screen.

Thanks,
 Jira cloud product management

 
{panel}
Previously, the form to add new release version was located at the very top of the page so you could add new versions right away.

Now, the form is located at the bottom of the "Releases" page and when you scroll down, more release versions are loaded making the form to go to the bottom again.

So, finally, to reach the form, you need to scroll all the way down to the very first version and only then the form is visible.

More than that, this makes it hard to understand if the version is added properly or not when you submit the form.

This makes the form hardly usable.

*Suggested solution:* Move the form to add new release version back to the top of the release versions page.
fields.summary: You need to scroll all the way down to add new release version in new JIRA Cloud design

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Issue search interface in the project page has problems with some resolutions.

The Open issues column slides across the screen when you click on the watchers button, and you cannot drag the column back until you close the watchers window. When it happens, other fields in the issue view get misconfigured. 

The problem is intermittent, but when it does not happen, the watchers windows gets cut as it passes a bit from the screen.

It happens when Safari is in full screen mode.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select Issues in your project page;
 # Click o the watchers button (the one that shows the number of watchers).

The client reported that the current resolution was 1920x1200. I was able to reproduce it in 1600x900 as well.
h3. Expected Results

The watchers window should adjust itself normally as it does on Google Chrome, for example.
h3. Actual Results

The interface tries to adjust the watchers window by modifying other elements.
h3. Workaround

The problem occurs only in Safari, so using another supported browsers (e.g. Google Chrome) should be fine. See [supported browsers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html].
fields.summary: Issue browse UI incompatibility with different resolutions in Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user set his/her profile timezone to (GMT+07:00) Novosibirsk, hovering on the user's name, the time displayed is not matching the timezone set.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Profile
# Edit preferences
# Choose "Asia" and "(GMT+07:00) Novosibirsk" for Time Zone
# Click Update
# Hover on your username in any issue (as assignee, reporter or someone who's commented)
# A popup will be shown which contains your time (based on your profile timezone)

h3. Expected Result
The time displayed in the popup matches your profile's timezone

h3. Actual Result
The time is not matching the timezone set in profile. It displays as GMT+6 timezone

h3. Workaround
Set a different city (i.e. Bangkok) with same timezone (GMT+07:00) in your profile.
fields.summary: User's timezone is displayed wrongly when the user's timezone is set to Novosibirsk (GMT+7)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'Test Run Results' summary may be showing incorrect information confirming that new issues were created when in fact issues were not created.

This happens when issue creation was unsuccessful because of workflow configuration (for example there is a workflow validator configured that prevent email issue from creation).
h3. Environment *

1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Configure email handler for your project.

2. Create a workflow validator for issue creation that requires a new field (e.g. 'Component' or 'Version')

3. Send email to the configured mailbox

4. Click 'Test' in mail handler settings

h3. Expected Results

Test should show that issue creation fails because required field (e.g. 'Component' or 'Version') was not specified.
h3. Actual Results

Test shows summary: "1 new issue created"
h3. Notes
fields.summary: 'Test Run Results' for mail handler is showing incorrect summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a new Cloud instance is created, a password reset link is sent to the site admin. However, when the *Reset my password* button is pressed, a *404 Page not found message* is displayed.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Cloud instance.
 # Check the password reset email sent to the site admin (see screenshot below).
 # Click the *Reset my password* button in the email.
 !image-2017-11-28-11-35-11-568.png!

h3. Expected Results
Presented with a page to reset the password.

h3. Actual Results
A Page not found error is displayed (see below).
!image-2017-11-28-11-37-40-437.png!

h3. Workaround
While in the new instance, create a sample project. Once this is completed, go to *User Management* and choose the site administrator user. Click *Reset password* on the top right. An password reset email is sent to the site admin. Clicking on the *Change my password* button on the email will preset the correct page to change the password.
fields.summary: Incorrect password reset link (in email) when a new instance is created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As a Jira Admin I want to change the date input format. I'm not using yet the new experience but I'm obliged to change for it to be able to modify how the date format is displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to General Configuration page of your JIRA instance ( Keyboard shortcut : double click the letter 'G' + Start typing 'General Configuration' and hit Enter) > Click on Advance Settings > Locate jira.date.* and replace the current value with the value below respectively and click Update :
 ** to change from dd/MMM/yy to MM/dd/yy (11/24/17):
 jira.date.picker.java.format = MM/dd/yyyy
 jira.date.picker.javascript.format = %m/%d/%Y
 jira.date.time.picker.java.format property = MM/dd/yy hh:mm a
 jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format property = %m/%d/%y %I:%M %p
 [As explained in this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/changing-the-due-date-input-format-192536.html]
 # However this just change the way to *enter/input* the values, but not the way how it is displayed.
 # *+The bug starts here+*: to change how the value is displayed without using the new experience, the expected fields does not show up under : *Date / time formats*
 # If, I change to *Jira new experience* as explained in this short video [https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cbXtbf2v8V], the fields will appear.
 # I am obliged to change to new experience.

h3. Expected Results

Being able to see the fields under the title *Date / time formats* in new and old experience.
h3. Notes

Please check the video [https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cbXtbf2v8V] it shows well the expected interface and the displayed one.
h3. Workaround

The workaround is described under the steps to reproduce title above.
fields.summary: In Look and Feel page, Date/time formats is blank in old Jira experience

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently *Time Tracking Report* from project reports will generate the report for a specific version, and there is no option in "Fix Version" field to choose all released/unreleased versions.


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide options to generate Time Tracking Report for all released, and all unreleased versions.
fields.summary: Time tracking report for all released/unreleased versions

fields.description:
Here's a suggestion and a use-case scenario by a customer:

h3. Suggestion
Can we setup Jirabot for Slack so it won’t reply to another bot? Maybe even select which bots to ignore?

h3. Use case scenario
For instance, we have a bot reporting on builds (succeeded, failed). The contents of the chat message contain commit messages. The commit messages contain Jira issue id's.

As the end result, Jirabot replies by listing the details of all mentioned Jira issue id's.

Can we make it like this? -> If the buildbot reports, Jirabot can ignore it
fields.summary: setup Jirabot for Slack so it won’t reply to another bot

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to paste the attachment from clipboard during a transition, the attachment is not uploaded.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue and make a transition (make sure the transition contains screen to allow the attachment of files)
# Attempt to add an image Copy an image from local machine
# Ctrl + V to paste image on comment

h3. Expected Results
The image is uploaded and the wiki markup of the attachments is automatically added to the comment.

h3. Actual Results
* The image is not uploaded 
* The wiki markup of the attachments is automatically added to the comment.
 !screenshot1.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Cannot add attachments with drag-and-drop functionality
* Cannot add attachments with manual insert functionality (by clicking on *Browse*)
* Able to add attachments to +Create issue+ screen
 !screenshot2.jpg|thumbnail! 
* Able to add attachments to +View issue+ screen
* This also happens on +Edit Issue+ screen

*Application Logs:*
No error on JIRA logs. Some errors cannot be found on Developer Tools which complaint about {{Project id wasn't set}}.
 !screenshot3.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Add the attachments on View Issue screen, then only transition the issue.
fields.summary: Cannot Upload Attachments on Issue Transition Screens OR Edit Issue Screen

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Jira Cloud does not have a button to import workflows due to this being a [restricted function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html]. [This method of importing a workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-import-a-workflow-into-a-jira-cloud-application-779160755.html] is not practical as it requires a Jira Server. There is another way by [sharing your workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/sharing-your-workflow-776636610.html]. However, when trying this, it's not possible to upload the workflow to Atlassian Marketplace. The workflow upload always comes back as rejected, as shown below.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Follow the steps in [Uploading to Atlassian Marketplace|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/sharing-your-workflow-776636610.html].

h3. Expected Results
* The workflow gets uploaded to Atlassian Marketplace

h3. Actual Results
* The workflow upload is rejected in Atlassian Marketplace

h3. Workaround
None. Customer is unable to share a workflow.
fields.summary: Importing Workflow from Marketplace is cumbersome and not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It would be useful to have a workflow condition available to allow the issue to be transitioned only after a specific hour, e.g. after 6 PM of the current day.

h3. Suggested Solution

Create a workflow condition to allow the issue to be transitioned only after a specific hour.
fields.summary: Condition to transition issue only after a specific hour

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no possibility to add a custom field that is of the same type as worklog

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility to add a custom field that is of the same type as worklog
fields.summary: Add possibility to have 'worklog' like type Custom fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Jira Cloud, the external system import does not have the option to import from other applications, i.e, FogBugz.

h3. Suggested Solution
Return this functionality as it was available in the past.

h3. Why this is important
Certain users want to import their data from different products, however, this can only be done using CSV. However, not all the tools have this option.

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Return of the external system import from different products

fields.description:
h3. Description

When trying to access Atlassian.com to download from this specific link [https://www.atlassian.com/whitepapers/agile-roadmap-planning-atlassian?_ga=2.191582506.1273837696.1511431122-195623873.1494523277] a PDF related to *roadmap planning*, nothing happens and the error in the screenshot is identified. 
h3. Expected behaviour: 

A pop-up message to download the PDF or informing that the PDF will be received via e-mail. 
h3. Attachment: 

Please check screenshot for error.
 !error console.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Error downloading agile roadmap planning PDF from atlassian.com

fields.description:
Hi,

in the new look and feel of Jira , the colour of the pie charts gadgets are very bright. 

Could you change that (in special the blue one) for another less damaged to the vision?

Or could you able to site admins to change that colours in the administraction look and feel area?
fields.summary: Change charts colours

fields.description:
Hi,

 

With the new look and feel in JIRA, administrators can't add or change colours in the admin "Look & Feel" section . We only can change Sidebar and Text and Icon Colour.

Please, restore back that funcionality  in the new look and feel.
fields.summary: Be able to edit and add new colour to gadgets headers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the project has a notification scheme where at least one event has no recipients configured the mentioned notifications may be duplicated or triplicated.

What happens is that Jira will generate one mentioned notification for each action performed.
 * If you add a comment mentioning someone - Jira generates only one notification
 * If you transition the issue and during the transition, you add a comment - Jira generates 2 notifications
 * If you transition the issue and during the transition, you add a comment and edit a field - Jira generates 3 notifications

All notification will be the same
{code:java}
xxxx mentioned you on xxx-1
{code}
h3. Customer Impact
h3. Environment

*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new notification scheme, don't add any recipients, let it empty
 # Go to a project and associate the empty notification scheme to this project
 # Edit the workflow in this project and add screens to the transitions
 # Create a new issue in this project
 # Perform a transition and, in the transition screen, add a comment mentioning someone and edit a field.

h3. Expected Results

Jira should generate only one mentioned notification
h3. Actual Results

Jira generates 3 mentioned notification to the mentioned user

*Application logs:*
h3. Notes
This behavior is also noticed even if the notification scheme has at least one event without a recipient.

h3. Workaround

Edit the notification scheme adding a single email as a recipient to the events, it can be a dummy email.
Note: The problem persists if the Project Lead is used as a recipient of the notifications, it's necessary to choose any other recipient in its place.
fields.summary: Jira duplicates mentioned notifications when the project has an empty event in the Notification Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the User Management section, there's no option to accept/reject multiple pending invitations, you need to accept or reject each user manually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to accept or reject multiple pending invitations at once

h3. Why this is important
This can save some time if the user have too many pending users to accept or reject the access to Jira.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Provide an option to accept or reject multiple pending invitations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46004].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently in notification JIRA admin are not allowed to remove a single user from the Reporter/Watcher/Assignee group which is receiving the notification. The JIRA Admin would like to remove specific user from the notification event while leaving them in Reporter/Watcher/Assignee group. 

*Suggested Solution*

Add ability in JIRA to remove specific user from the notification event.

*Workaround*

Currently there is no workaround to remove specific users from the notification event.
fields.summary: Remove specific user from notification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Uploading attachments larger than 800MB via REST API fails with {{504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT}} HTTP on the client side and with a {{499}} HTTP on Nginx side.

From the tests we've done so far, we were also able to reproduce the issue when uploading attachments from 164MB up to 328MB. However, these attachments were uploaded successfully regardless of the response received. 

Attachments up to 82MB were uploaded correctly and a proper {{200 HTTP}} was received.

Example logs for Nginx:
{code}time	src_ip	status	request_size	request_time	request_method	uri_path	http_referer	http_user_agent
2017-11-13T20:23:31Z	10.106.82.122	499	1614010186	319.165	POST	/rest/api/2/issue/ABC-51802/attachments		python-requests/2.17.3{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# POST a large attachment via API endpoint {{/rest/api/2/issue/<issue_key>attachments}}.
# Watch the response code

h3. Expected Results
If there is a limitation in content length, a proper response should be sent clarifying why the request failed. Additionally, a 499 Nginx code suggested the connection closed on the client-side, when in truth it seems to be closed by our ELB.

h3. Actual Results
Client receives a {{504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT}} and Nginx shows a {{499}}.
fields.summary: Unable to POST attachments greater than 800MB

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

There is no way to show the history points column for sub-tasks on issue view.
h3. Suggested Solution:

A column that allows users to see the history points of a sub-task.
h3. Why is this important:

The process to know the total of history points of an issue would consume less time if the sub-tasks show a column with their history points.
h3. Workaround:

Open the sub-tasks one-by-one to see their history points.
fields.summary: Show story points column for sub-tasks on issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever the Jira Toolkit custom field *Company* is used in searches or filters, there is a chance that all related result where the company name matches the reporter domain would not be returned. 
The results are not returned for reporter usernames or emails that contain uppercase characters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Acquire the Jira Toolkit add-on
# Configure the company field for an issue
# Create a service desk customer in uppercase for Example <Shakiru.Ayanloye@atlassian.com>
# Report an issue with the user <Shakiru.Ayanloye@atlassian.com>
# Try to run a query (company = "atlassian.com")

h3. Expected Results

Results for the issue should be returned

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is returned.

h3. Workaround
Changing the user email address to lowercase should resolve this.
fields.summary: Jira Toolkit custom field "Company" not puling all related issue
Issue Collector using Components field in a Custom Template, shows the Template Preview blank
